responses: Hello, thanks for asking
Good to see you again
Hi there, how can I help?
See you!
Have a nice day
Bye! Come back again soon.
Happy to help!
Any time!
My pleasure
Sorry, I didn't understand that.
Could you please rephrase your question?
Not sure I understand. Can you give me more details?

patterns: Tell me how you can help
List the things you can do
responses: I can help you with adverse drug reaction info, blood pressure tracking, department directions, visiting hours, and nurse requests.

patterns: How to check Adverse drug reaction?
Give me a list of drugs causing adverse behavior
List all drugs suitable for patient with adverse reaction
Which drugs don't have adverse reactions?
responses: Navigating to the adverse drug reaction module.

patterns: I want to log blood pressure results
responses: Navigating to the blood pressure module.

patterns: I want to search for blood pressure result history
Show blood pressure results for patient
Find blood pressure results by ID
Can I see past blood pressure readings?
History of blood pressure for patient
responses: Please provide the patient ID.
Patient ID, please?
Loading blood pressure results for the patient.

patterns: I need to go to the pharmacy
responses: The hospital pharmacy is located on the ground floor near the main entrance. It's open from 8 AM to 6 PM.

patterns: How do I get to radiology?
responses: You can find department information at the main information desk or I can help guide you. Which department are you looking for?

patterns: When can I visit a patient?
What time can I see someone?
Until what time are visits allowed?
responses: Visiting hours are from 10 AM to 8 PM daily.
You can visit between 10 in the morning and 8 in the evening.
Visitors are welcome from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM.

patterns: Please send a nurse to my room
I need help from a nurse
responses: A nurse has been notified and will be with you shortly.
Hang tight, we're notifying the nurse.
We'll send someone to assist you soon.

patterns: How do I get to radiology?
Can you direct me to cardiology?
I need to go to the lab
I gotta get to the lab
How do I get to imaging?
responses: Sure, which department are you looking for?
Please tell me the department name and I can help with directions.

patterns: How do I find the elevators?
I need to find a vending machine
How do I get to snacks?
Where can I grab a coffee?
responses: The cafeteria is on the first floor near the main entrance. Bathrooms and elevators are marked throughout the hospital.
Sure, I can help with that. What facility are you looking for?

patterns: Do you have any wheelchairs available?
Where can I request a wheelchair?
Help me get a wheelchair please
Can I get one of them wheelchairs?
Y'all got a wheelchair I can use?
I need some wheels to get around
responses: A nurse has been notified to assist you with a wheelchair.
We'll have a wheelchair brought to your location shortly.

patterns: When will I get lab results?
Can I check my test results?
I'm waiting on blood test results
Any update on my lab work?
They done with my blood work?
responses: Please check with your assigned nurse or doctor for lab results, as I can't access patient records directly.
You'll be notified by staff when your results are ready.

patterns: What room is John Smith in?
Where can I find my friend who was admitted?
Can you tell me the room number for my cousin?
Which room is my family member in?
I want to visit a patient, where are they?
I'm tryna find my buddy who got admitted
Any idea where my aunt is staying?
Where'd y'all move my friend to?
responses: Please check with the front desk or provide the patient's full name so we can assist you further.
For privacy reasons, room information is provided at the front desk with proper identification.

patterns: How do I get to intensive care?
I'm looking for the emergency department
Where can I find the surgery wing?
Show me how to get to neurology
How do I get to the baby ward?
responses: You can find department locations at the main information desk, or I can help guide you. Which department are you visiting?
Please follow hospital signage or ask the front desk if you need more detailed directions.

patterns: How do I check in as a visitor?
Do I need to sign in to visit someone?
Do I need to register before visiting a patient?
Do I gotta check in first?
Where do I sign in to see someone?
I'm here to visit, what do I do?
Do I need a badge to go in?
responses: Yes, please check in at the front desk when you arrive. Visitor badges are usually required.
Visitor check-in is located at the main entrance. A staff member will help you from there.
